text.__SUMMARY__: The Indian hare (Lepus nigricollis), also known as the black-naped hare, is a common species of hare found in the Indian Subcontinent and in Java. Introduced to Madagascar, Comoro Islands, Andaman Islands, Irian Jaya, Papua New Guinea, Seychelles, Mayotte, Mauritius and Réunion
text.Taxonomy:
There are 7 recognized subspecies of Indian hare.

Lepus nigricollis aryabertensis
Lepus nigricollis dayanus
Lepus nigricollis nigricollis
Lepus nigricollis ruficaudatus
Lepus nigricollis sadiya
Lepus nigricollis simcoxi
Lepus nigricollis singhala
